Name: Nautches
Description:
Nautches is a deck of 120 hexagonal cards, used to play a number of abstract games ranging from two-player territory-building games, to multiplayer trick-based games, to meditative solitaire games. Each side of a Nautches card is marked with notches indicating a value between 0 and 5. Each of the 120 cards has a unique sequence of notches. Each card also has one of six suits and one of two colors. Most games are based on placing such that the notches on any touching sides of cards have matching values.

—description from the designer

Name: Flick of Faith: Veles God Promo
Description:
Another contender joins the bet.
Veles can use Prophets and Temples of any other god currently not in the game.
After scoring Navel you can put the Prophet in any place on the Island closest to your Corner instead of discarding it.

This promo was created to celebrate Flick of Faith worldwide premiere. Ask Awaken Realms Lite on any convention if it is still obtainable!

Name: Now That's What I Call Music Card Game
Description:
Re-live the last few decades of great music in this fast moving card game based on the chart topping Now That's What I Call Music albums.
Players rolls a die to determine which question they will answer. If they get the answer right they keep the card and place it in front of them, showing the letter on the back.
The first player to spell "N O W !" using the cards wins.

Name: People Vs Pandemic
Description:
Get all the "Human" players to the center of the game board before the Virus beats them to it. If even one Human is left behind, the Virus wins! The Virus can be ruthless by using "exposure spots" and attack cards to slow the Humans' pace... but if the Humans play their cards right, they might just be able to defend themselves. If not, they risk going into quarantine. Both the Virus and Humans can progress forward by using action cards. But beware, not all actions have positive outcomes! Players can also trade and stock up on the three sacred resources of 2020:  Toilet paper (AKA, 2020 Gold), hand sanitizer (AKA Liquid Life), and groceries (AKA Bare Necessities). Family-friendly. Print-from-home.

—description from the designer

Name: Kaadoo: The Big Game – The Big Roar
Description:
Where can you can see both the Lion and the Tiger in the same forest?

We call it the Land of the Big Roar! A whole range of wild animals from India that would leave you spellbound.

Find out if Sykes’s Nightjar is a jar of cookies! Or is Sambar the famed South Indian dish? Does the Spectacled Cobra suffer from poor eyesight? Watch the graceful Leopard on a hunt, drinking water or perched on a tree. Or t-he stunning Royal Bengal Tigress with her cubs. How about two tigers fighting it out between themselves? Then, there is the protective Lioness lounging around with her cute little ones.. Wish you were there?

Travel through the sprawling jungles of India with your friends and discover a stunning range of birds, reptiles, and mammals. They get you points and make you the winner. It is the Leopard that gets you 20 points while the King of the Jungle gets you only 10. Find out why!

—description from the publisher

Name: Union City Alliance
Description:
A Cooperative Superhero Deck and Board Building game for a team of 2-4 Players. Each chooses an iconic champion to play as and work together to confront and defeat a central supervillain. Each hero has their own unique starter deck of Origin cards that highlight that character's unique strengths and skills. Each Hero also comes with a Deck of super-powerful Solo Cards that only they have access to, featuring their most powerful abilities.

On their turn, players will explore to add new map panels to the board. Each Map Panel contains new Union Cards to add to their deck. There are also City cards with Challenges to overcome and Enemies to defeat, collecting outrageous rewards. Beyond that, Map Panels have Actions and special set-ups so you never know what's going to be around the corner! Players control how the board is built and a one-of-a-kind Map is constructed each game.

All the while, the Peril of the Supervillain grows, their plot escalates, and they unleash minions, maniacal machinations, and bring their own formidable combat prowess to bear. Each Supervillain has their own means of conquering the city, each time you build the board it is different, and each Hero has their own powers that they can add to and hone as part of your own Union City Alliance!

-description from designer

Name: Altar Quest: Stretch Goals
Description:
Stretch goals from the Altar Quest kickstarter, including an alternate game board, 135 additional miniatures, 417 new cards, and an exclusive expansion "Call of the Lunarin" designed by Isaac Childres, creator of Gloomhaven.

About Call of the Lunarin:
The dark moors of Swales are some of the most dangerous hunting grounds in Aridika. It is there that the Lunarin stalk their prey under baleful moons. The leavings of the Thrall empire riddle the land with structures abandoned and broken, casting long shadows across the eerie landscape. Kickstarter exclusive expansion for Altar Quest.

Name: Altar Quest: The First Four Hero Pack
Description:
When the first four races of Eastony made an alliance after years of conflict, it began an age of heroes and prosperity. Five Holds was founded, and the Council of Middenvale forged a unified order of law and melting pot of cultures. However, this was before the coming of Szera… 


When the Pheran Empire fell, Szera claimed the harsh and untamed lands of western Eastony as her own. Heroes were called, but none could bring justice to Szera’s unholy tyranny. After the second invasion of Szera’s forces into Five Holds, the Church of the Guided Light chose their greatest champions to lead a counterattack against Szera’s hordes. 


While this historic campaign held many trials and lasted many years, only four legendary heroes managed to brave the tower of Arkenspire and bound Szera between life and death in the Arkenhold.

The First Four allows players to take on the role of one of the First Four Heroes of Eastony. Gavin Ulrich, Aeveth Namoura, Karon Harrick, and Willow Banks are renowned heroes of legend who defeated Szera and bound her in the ruins of Arkenspire. This hero pack includes all the cards and miniatures needed to bring these legendary heroes into your games of Altar Quest!

Includes 4 miniatures, 140 cards, and 4 dividers.

Name: Al'Taire: The Alchemy Wars
Description:
In Al'Taire The object of the game is to be the first
player to reach 6 Ascension Points on
your turn, which ends the game with a
successful claim to the throne.
Ascension Points are gained through
Alchemy Cards, Fate Cards, and even
through some Reagent Cards.
How many players can play Al'Taire?
2 to 4 players
How long does a game generally last?
Depending how menacing and cutthroat players are it can range from 30 minutes to 1 1/2 hours.
What is included in the game?
The game box, instruction manual, 50 Alchemy cards and 50 Reagent cards.
How do I play?
In Al'Taire players need reagent cards to put alchemy cards into play. Some alchemy cards grant you alchemy points, additional cards, etc, or they can destroy your opponent(s) through causing of discarded cards, loss of alchemy points to even switching hands entirely.
Al'Taire uses the "one person's trash is another person's treasure." mechanic. If a player pitches a discard that you need you may draw from the top of the discard pile.

—description from the designer

Name: It's Kind of a Fun Story
Description:
It's Kind of a Fun Story is a getting-to-know-you storytelling game for acquaintances or a revealing party game for friends you thought you already knew everything about. Players tell stories, compete to best fit card descriptions, and sometimes steal cards from one another, in a bid to get to know each other and win!

To begin, each player takes one 'Nope' card and two 'Hear Me Out' cards. The deck is then shuffled, placed in the center of the table, and ten 'Take a Chance' cards are placed beside it.

On your turn you draw a card and follow its instructions. There are four types of cards. The Story Cards are worth two points, while the others are all worth one.

When you draw a Story Card, you must answer the question on the card, such as 'what was your least favorite job?' or 'who was your arch-nemesis growing up?'. If for some reason you do not wish or do not have a story for the card, you may skip it and draw a new card. Another player may take a skipped card to answer on his turn rather than drawing a new one if he wishes.

If you are the only one who answered the Story Card, you place it in your score pile. However, a player may discard a 'Hear Me Out' card if she also wishes to tell a story for the prompt. Players then vote on who should win the card. If you have already used your 'Hear Me Out' cards, you may place a 'Take a Chance' card into your score pile instead, in order to answer another player's Story Card. These are worth negative one point.

The 'Left or Right' cards require you to decide which player on either side of you best fits the description on the card. The 'Point a Finger' card requires everyone to vote on who best fits the description. Finally, for the 'Everybody Answers' card, each player gives a brief answer to the prompt or question and then votes on who wins the card.

If, during a story, the topic ever veers into territory you are not comfortable with, you simply hold up your Nope Card, and the story immediately ends. There is no penalty and the current player simply draws a new card. Nope Cards are not meant to be used in any competitive fashion, and are simply there to keep everyone comfortable with the game content.

When a player wins a card they place it in their scoring pile. The first player to 7 points wins the game.

Now that that’s out of the way, are YOU ready to lay all your cards on the table?

The game contains 320 cards and an endless amount of stories to be shared.

Trying to keep this PG? All our decks are customizable with Rated-R cards that can be removed if your mom wants in on the fun. (Or keep them, your call).

-description from designer

Name: Star Eater
Description:
Star Eater combines innovation, stylised scifi action and gorgeous illustration to create a uniquely satisfying and strategically competitive experience for 2-4 players.

You play as the commander of a gigantic Capital Ship, with multiple weapons and systems to manage as a supplemental force of on-board Corvettes.

Each faction has unique Capital ships to choose from, each with customizable weapons, corvettes and utilities tailored to specific roles. Before the game begins, Commanders will customize their capital ships and corvettes to suit their playstyle and strategy.

Star Eater uses an inertia based movement system. Each turn a commander can fire the capital ship engines to gain, bleed off, or redirect their momentum. Acquired momentum is tracked with tokens and each turn the momentum will continue to affect the capital ships movement turn after turn until it is removed.

Each turn, both players will place face down: an engine Dial with a setting selected and 2 command cards.
When both players agree that they are ready, they will reveal their engine dials at the same time, then apply the relevant momentum to their capital ship. All capital ships on the board are then moved according to the momentum they possess.
Once movement is complete, the players reveal their command cards simultaneously and play out their effects.

Most commands attract cooldown which removes them from the game for a set number of turns after use. The amount of cooldown attracted by a particular command is determined by the components that commander has chosen to outfit their capital ship with.
There are 8 command cards, each of which will activate one component of the warship; main and broadside weapons, point defense turrets and shields, emergency engine power and various special abilities. Controlling corvettes is also done via command cards.

Capital ships are composed of many sections. Each individual piece of the capital ship has its own armor rating, and the ship as a whole has an internal structure health. To damage your opponent's structural health, you must strip away their armor and then land shots in the resulting gap. When a capital ship runs out of internal structure health, it is destroyed and their opponent wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Druidas
Description:
A long time ago, two half-serving wizards lived in the depths of an old forest. The two were in training, but one day they were called by their master.

"I will test you from now on. Let's recognize the person who completed" Magical Remedy "first as a full-fledged wizard."

In order to make "magical remedies", plants and minerals, parts of the body of animals and phantom beasts, and "fire (red)" "water (blue)" "earth (yellow)" "trees (green)" You must synthesize "rune stone" that has the magical power of "mineral (white)". You will be one of the wizards and collect medicine materials in the fantasy forest. Then extract the magical power from the "rune stone" and complete the medicine faster than your rivals.

In this game, players take all stones of the same color on either the magic circle card or the center of the table and place them on the icon in their hand. Points will be deducted for stones that cannot be placed or surplus stones. When the stones are buried on the 5 icons in your hand, the card is complete. Get the score written on the card.

If you do not meet the end-of-game conditions, replenish the magic circle card with rune stones and perform the next round. In this way, the player who gets 30 points first is recognized as a full-fledged wizard by the master.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Stormcast Eternals
Description:
As Sigmar's glorious crusade across the Mortal Realms continues, the forces of the Stormcast Eternals form his vanguard. From the noble warriors of the Strike Chambers to the vicious beasts of the Extremis Chambers and the brave scouts of the Vanguard Auxiliary Chambers, this volume covers the entire range of Stormcast, complete with extensive background and a Stormhost of rules!

A glorious vision of golden celestial light, a living embodiment of the God-King's might, the Stormcast Eternals are messengers of vengeance armed with the might of stars. Once-mortal champions of Order forged by Sigmar into an astonishing fighting force, hurled down from the heavens to meet the forces of Chaos head-on, they wreak bloody revenge on the Dark Gods, the corruptors of the realms. Following the brutal battles of the All-gates, the Stormcast Eternals lead the forces of Order in reclaiming the lands of the Mortal Realms, leveraging the power of the heavens to smite the corruptions of Chaos that plague these territories.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Stormcast Eternals
Description:
Each Stormcast Eternal was once a mortal warrior who sought to defy the dominion of Chaos, no matter the cost. Taken into the heavens by Sigmar himself and reforged into a living embodiment of the God-King's might, these warriors have the power of the storm in their blood. Thundering down in meteoric blasts of celestial energy, the indomitable Stormhosts take their bloody revenge on the hordes of the Dark Gods.

This book will teach you about the glory of the God-King's heroes. You will gain great insights into high Azyr and the brotherhoods striking like thunderbolts across the Mortal Realms.

Name: War Chest: Siege
Description:
Not all battles are fought on the open field. In many cases defenders hide behind the thick walls of mighty castles. Now is the time to prepare for Siege! As castles grew larger and stronger throughout the middle ages, new ways evolved to scale, knock down, and even undermine their walls.

In War Chest: Siege, you will be confronted with fortified locations. Fear not, you have siege towers and trebuchets at your disposal and hardy sappers to both build your own fortifications and undermine your opponents'. Can you successfully return to the battlefield with your war engines in this ingenious and engaging game of tactics and strategy?

—description from the publisher

Name: Paupers' Ladder: The Bodachs of Brighthelm
Description:
As the moon rises they crawl from their dark, mouldering lairs. These night horrors that scare Brighthelm’s children from sleep. These mysterious, mischievous and downright malevolent bogeymen are using Garolium’s tournament as the perfect foil for a power grab. The question is, which of these quarreling bodachs will climb to the top of their festering pile?

The Bodachs of Brighthelm is a little Halloween-themed expansion for Paupers' Ladder. It adds 4 characters to play in the place of Paupers. The Bodachs, who can enslave creatures to become their familiars and trick or treat opposing players in their quest for power.

Also available as a print and play PDF, this physical version is limited to 100 copies.

Name: Yatzoo
Description: A Yahtzee variant for children from ages 5 up. Numbers in the dice have been replaced with animals, and you try to roll as many same animals as possible. There are no straights and no bonuses for the upper part of the scoring sheet, so the rules have been simplified quite a bit.

Name: EQUILIBRIX Combact
Description: This package of black-and-white puzzle pieces brings completely new dimension into EQULIBRIX series. Every puzzle piece is unique in terms of its shape and ability to create the connections with other puzzle pieces. This time you will experience a very close duel on the Connect game board (the box does not contain the game board). How the duel will look like? It depends largely on the game option you choose.

Name: モックワード (Mock Word)
Description:
ãƒ¢ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ (Mock Word) is word game from Japan with a reversal on the common method. Instead of players trying to identify the hidden word, they have to fit words to hidden categories. The game can be played just for fun, or can be played more seriously to win or lose.

In Mock Word, one player is a Respondent, the other players form the Support, a co-operative team, of which one player is an Ojama. At the start of the game, the team players compose a series of words by secretly writing a single character at a time of cards. The cards get passed around, so each player contributes to forming the words. The Ojama is acting a sort of spoiler, secretly trying to make nonsense words as they form. This can produce hilarious words and makes the game a lot of fun.

Once the words are set, the Respondent tries to identify the theme words that fit each of the composed words. If they can, all the players score points except the Ojama. If the Respondent cannot match the words to the themes, then the Ojama scores points. At the game end, most points wins. 
user summary

Name: Keyword
Description:
Keyword is a game where a player has to communicate a word to the rest of their team, describing it in terms of a secret "keyword" which only that team knows. A second team eavesdrops on the conversation, trying to work out what they're talking about.

—description from the designer
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Our Cartoon President
Description:
Let’s face it — nothing simulates the chaos of the current administration like a combination of rotten vegetables and confetti being dropped on a high-speed fan, but this game is the next best thing!

In this fast-moving card game, each player takes control of a group of government staffers and wins loyalty for their people while stealing it from others, all while trying to avoid the wrath of the president. People will be fired, transferred, and otherwise totally embarrassed, but there can be only one winner! And it sure won't be the nation!


     Based on Stephen Colbert’s animated show Our Cartoon President.
     Provides much needed laugh-out-loud outlet in regards to American Politics!
     Blank Character cards allow you to keep up with political events!


—description from the back of the box

Name: The GearSeed Saga
Description:
The world of GearSeed is a peculiar place. Its seasons shift sporadically and the strange folk that call this world home do their best to adapt to its ever changing landscape.

The GearSeed Saga is a boxed collection of 2 completely different card games set in the same world.

SYNOD is a Kickstarter Exclusive Micro game for 2 players and was illustrated by Sandro Rybak.

GearSeed is a combo driven, tile laying card game for 2 to 4 players and features the illustrations of Oliver Howe. Artist Jason Benningfield is responsible for all of the icon work that ties these two games together.

Name: EQUILIBRIX Project
Description: Project is actually an extension of the game Connect, because it uses most of the material from it and develops the main game principles in depth. This time, however, it is a political game in which you try to build various geometric shapes together. But you also get points for encircling your opponent.

Name: Legends Untold: Illumination of Deepsorrow Novice Set
Description:
The Illumination of Deepsorrow is a standalone expansion for the Legends Untold system which can be enhanced with the addition of the Weeping Caves and Great Sewers Novice Sets. It can also be combined with these products to create a massive catalogue of cards for self-build adventures.
 Deepsorrow introduces:
Four new playable Occupations and Cultures, along with a host of new Weapons, Kits, Outfits and Talents to let you build the character you want.

A new Focus system that allows you to use the mystic teachings of the Nabti Walkers to push your body and mind to the limits of endurance.

New Physiological Talents for the Wrathlander - use natural gifts to survive poison and even channel lightning!

A new Shock Condition that impacts both Heroes and Foes, beware that sparking floor tile!

A new Clues and Epilogues system that rewards exploration – will you brave that Vine Swing Barrier to reveal more about the multiple factions that have an interest in the ancient site?

New Boons and Backpack cards that let you expand your party’s arsenal of options, you must use them wisely to ensure your survival.

New Loot categories including Locked, Sealed, and Heavy, that require you to use all your wits to benefit from them.

A new Treasure deck system for those that always have to find every piece of loot.

A Cinematic Campaign of multiple Plot Arcs, that you must discover and interact as you explore Deepsorrow.

Exhausted, a messenger collapses on the steps of the temple. From his hand a single leaf drops to the floor and a shockwave echoes across the sanctuary. The Monks at Firesorrow have waited millennia for the sign - the Lost Forest has come to life - A Step into Darkness has begun.

Where the sky screams and black clouds roar 
Where the sand climbs high and eagles soar 
Secrets will travel by sail and oar
To Dip’Sa’Ra on distant shore

The violent wind whips sand across your face; overhead the constant lightning of the Wrathstorm earths into the enormous coral-like spires that tower above you. You are sworn to your quest: you must investigate the mysteries of Deepsorrow and find the ancient Illumolith so that you may shine a beacon of light and illuminate the approaching darkness.

-description from publisher

Name: Raja Ampat: The Four Kings Islands
Description:
A little semi-abstract style game, where you are initially building the map of islands, then placing your wildlife tokens according to the following conditions: you cannot place an animal in a row, column or island that already contains that type of animal.


Released in the June 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Mountaineering: The Race to the Summit
Description:
The game is unbranded

The image on the box with coloured scene of climbers and a tent flying the British flag suggests that it was probably published in England after Sir Edmund Percival Hillary and Sherpa mountaineer Tenzing Norgay became the first climbers confirmed to have reached the summit of Mount Everest, on 29 May 1953.

Contents:

     collapsible pyramid with mountain scenes printed in colours;
     printed base with slots for the mountain;
     four coloured, round headed playing pins;
     one wooden dice;
     one dice shaker;


The rules of the game are printed on the underside of the box lid.

Name: ArchiWrecks
Description:
ArchiWrecks is a card and dice game for 2 players: the architect that builds the city, and a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

ArchiWrecks is an asymmetric 2-player only dexterity game. One of the players takes on the role of architect constructing buildings out of dice, the other player takes on the role of a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

Each card has the Architect constructing a specific building with dice, the card also offers a way for the Monster player to attempt to wreck the building. After each round, the card is flipped and either shows the city making progress or the rubble of the city as the Monster smashed past.

Name: Pocket Pairs
Description:
Pocket Pairs is a fast-paced game about finding the commonalities among a card collection. A 9-card game where you must cut the cards into 18 1/2-size cards.


Pocket Pairs is a fast-paced card game about collecting cards, then deciding what items they have in common, such as a Pencil and Paper Clip are both found in an office. Add in a Toy Soldier and they all have a pointy bit! Great for teaching associations and developing critical thinking skills.


Released in the November 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: I Am… Alias
Description:
Party game, where the players put on a headband and pick a card from a deck. Everyone attaches their card on the the headband and one person at a time tries to explain the word to another player (who cannot see their card). Right guess grants points and the player gets to move their pawn forward.

—user summary

Slap on a headband and get ready to explain! Tell the other players who they are, but don’t say the word on the card!
This time you can never be sure who you are, but you’re guaranteed to have a great time, aka lots of fun!

The player, who gets the furthest during a set number of rounds, wins the game!
 Everyone plays at the same time!
The game is full of hilarious characters and funny moments.
A fast-moving, rib-tickling word explaining game!
 —description from the publisher

Name: Miss Match
Description:
Miss Match is a fun, quick and simple game for 2-12 players of all ages.

Players race to find a link between the cards on the table in fun and creative ways. The cards are always changing so, think fast and shout out a match before someone else can. You keep the cards you matched and that’s how you score points in the game. The more cards you can match at once the more points you score each round.

—description from the designer

Name: Runeslingers: The Awakening
Description:
"Runeslingers: The Awakening" is a strategic customizable card game that ingeniously melds board game and dueling card game elements into a wholly unique strategy gaming experience. It promises to challenge even the most seasoned gaming veterans with its myriad strategic win conditions, card combinations, and decision trees that confront players each turn.

Take on the role of a Runeslinger, a wielder of magical incantations known as runespells. Much of the game's art features runestones, ancient stone artifacts that empower your Runeslinger with runespells. Each runespell possesses a class affinity that provides guidance on its thematic origins and strategic pairings but does not limit card pairings in deck construction.

The game's objective is straightforward: diminish the enemy Runeslinger's power from five to zero. Achieve this by dealing damage, applying ailments, or discarding the enemy's cards to weaken their power. Reduce the enemy Runeslinger's maximum health to zero, or deplete their entire deck and discard pile to secure instant victory! With five distinct win conditions coupled with a unique ailment system, "Runeslingers" stands as an exceptionally complex yet rewarding strategy game that introduces significant mechanical advancements to the genre.

Customize your Runeslinger with a unique stance and ability to further develop specific strategies, limited only by your creativity. Select from a pool of over 180 unique cards in the Alpha set, and assemble a 40-card deck with no class or color restrictions. Employ six unique ailments that dynamically alter gameplay on a moment's notice. Master the art of shouting, Runeslinger's distinctive take-that mechanic that enables you to disrupt enemy actions, even when it's not your turn!

If you seek a challenging and genuinely strategic game, your search ends with "Runeslingers!"

Name: Salvage Hidden Treasures: Bounties of the Abyss
Description:
Continue in your pursuit to collect the world’s most elusive treasure - this time diving into the eerie depths with the Bounties of the Abyss expansion set.

Bounties of the Abyss Expansion set includes three additional boats plus sixteen additional tiles featuring new artwork, cruel twists of fate and treasures long forgotten to the depths of the ocean will merge seamlessly into your core game of Salvage Hidden Treasures!

—description from the designer

Name: Lost & Found: New Harvest
Description:
Show your strategic and collaborative skills in Lost & Found: New Harvest, a historical strategy game of balance between community and family needs.

In this standalone expansion to Lost & Found, players explore how lost and found possessions were addressed under Islamic jurisprudence, as informed by Al-Hidayah and The Distinguished Jurist's Primer. These texts were written in the 12th century by great Islamic scholar and jurists Burhan al-Din al-Marghinani and the polymath Ibn Rushd (Averroes). They provide guideposts for behavior, but it’s up to you to decide how to solve dilemmas.

Set in medieval North Africa, towns are built by families like yours. Take on one of five roles in a struggle to address dilemmas, overcome crises, and avert disasters that threaten to destroy everything you know and love. Look out for your family, but be sure to collaborate with your neighbors as well. Any number of players can win, but if anyone goes destitute, everyone loses.

Explore the ways in which these medieval religious legal systems helped to hold society together and helped to keep neighbors cooperating with one another. Optionally, you can pair Lost & Found: New Harvest with the original Lost & Found and take on both Jewish and Muslim roles, and explore how these laws play out for these two communities living in Fustat (Old Cairo) in the 12th century.

Will you follow the laws of lost and found possessions? Will you break them? Will you go above and beyond the law?

Name: Rally Round the Flag: Division Command
Description:
Rally Round the Flag – Division Command is an operational game pitting the Union and Confederate Armies against each other during the three days of the Battle of Gettysburg. Each side is represented by each of the Army, Corps and Division Commanders at the Battle of Gettysburg and the Brigades under their command. Take control of the Confederate Army and use their consolidated command structure to try and wrest control of Gettysburg from the Union.

Or, take control of the Union Army and work to delay the Confederates long enough for reinforcements to arrive. Can the Union survive the confusion of command before Meade can arrive with the Army artillery reserves? Can Lee push forward far enough on the first day to sustain his position for the second and third days? Can you win the Battle of Gettysburg and decide the fate of the American Civil War?

The Division Command level is designed with the ability to take and hold ground. This is represented by controlling the critical road network surrounding the town of Gettysburg. This is accomplished by taking control of specific points along the roads called “March Circles,” and thus scoring Victory Points.

A standard Division Command level game covering all three days of the Battle of Gettysburg can be played in about 8-12 hours. Victory occurs either when you force your opponent’s army to retreat, or you have the majority of the 43 Victory Points by the end of the game. You force your opponent to retreat by having double their amount of Victory Points at the end of a day of battle, thus earning a decisive victory.

Rally Round the Flag – Division Command can also be played as a Campaign Manager within the Rally Round the Flag – Brigade Command game. This allows the Division Command game to act as a “campaign battle generator,” creating tactical battles that can be played in 2 to 3 hours, skipping past unnecessary actions and combats in the Brigade Command system and shaving a 40 to 60 hour long game down to 25 hours or less.

While Rally Round the Flag was painstakingly designed with historical accuracy at its heart, the outcome of the game is not predetermined. The design reflects the tactical, organizational, and operational limits of both Union and Confederate armies and their generals, but how you manage them is up to you. In this battle, your decisions make the difference.

—description from the publisher

Name: Do It Yourself Alias
Description:
You get to create the classic game Alias yourself! Choose the words of your liking and write them on the cards. The game itself plays like a regular Alias, a word explanation game where you explain words without reveiling the word itself (or a part of it): whether they are synonyms, antonyms or whatever works best in the situation, this party game sure makes it fun to play with words - and now with the new DIY cards!

In D.I.Y. Alias players come up with their own words based on the topics in the cards. Once you have a word in mind, write it on the card, start explaining and let the other players guess. The first player to reach the finish wins the game!

Content: Double-sided game board, 300 cards, sand timer, rules.

Name: Shaolia: Great Houses
Description:
Shaolia: Great Houses is an expansion to Shaolia: Warring States which brings not only new cards, but also new mechanics and game modes to give the players more options in pursuing their paths to victory.

The expansion introduces the titular Great Houses. There is also a solo mode new to Shaolia which introduces a Boss for the player to battle.

A game of Great Houses proceeds much the same as one of Warring States, but with the addition of the Noble House tiles and Quest cards. These two new components work in tandem.

Noble House Tiles
These tiles can be purchased during the purchase phase of the game. The currency to purchase them are Quest cards that players have earned in the game. After a Noble House tile has been purchased, it is immediately replaced by another from the deck.

Noble House tiles are placed near the player’s territory board, and function the same as Level 1 & 2 cards, with one important exception: They cannot be attacked, blocked, or destroyed, so a player will benefit from their abilities until the end of the game.

Quest Cards
If a player completes the requirement listed on a Quest card during their turn, they get to take the quest card into their hands. Another Quest card from the deck is immediately drawn to replace the one taken.

As mentioned previously, Quest cards can be used to purchase Noble House tiles. Alternately, you may sell one a Quest card for 2 gold.

There are two types of Quest cards: ones that are immediately achieved by meeting their requirements, and ones with 2–3 open slots that require players to repeat the action listed on the card that many times before they complete the quest. Cards with these repeating quests can only be completed by whoever does the action first, claiming it with one of their quest trackers.

A game of Shaolia: Great Houses ends the same turn that someone either gains 18 culture, or does 12 damage to their opponent’s palace. Additionally, there will be that previously-mentioned third victory path achieved through completing quests.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Depth Track Accessory + Card Mini-Expansion
Description:
The Deluxe Depth Track Expansion is a great way to add a bit of extra flair and theme to your Shadows of Brimstone adventures! This set includes 1 large high-detail plastic Depth Track for use while adventuring down in the dusty Mines of the Old West, as well as 1 textured plastic Hero Posse marker ring and 1 textured plastic Darkness marker ring.

This set also includes 15 new cards for the game (4 Gear, 3 Mine Encounters, 4 Darkness, and 4 Growing Dread).  They are themed for racing against time to hold the darkness at bay!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Donostiarrok harriz harri
Description:
Donostiarrok harriz harri is a cooperative game about the reconstruction of Donostia / San Sebastian after its burning in 1813 by Wellington troops. 
The players, representing witnesses of the massacre and inhabitants of the city - Juana Francisca Arsuaga (servant), José Antonio Aguirrebarrena (carpenter), María D. Miloy "La naipera", Vda. de Barbot (maker of cards) and Manuel Joaquín de Alcain Baraibar (merchant and mayor) must rebuild the city, they all win or lose together.

gameplay:
The board represents the burned intramural city, with a grid of paths that the characters must travel. 
At start of game the four characters are in the Plaza Nueva among the remains of the city.
The 4 players must rebuild the city. For that they must help each other to figure out where to start the reconstruction and to get the seven parts of the facade of a typical reconstruction building.
To advance, some brick tiles are used and as many bricks as the number of steps you want to advance will be used. 
But the reconstruction was not easy and that is why the game also has adversity events (discouragement, illnesses, wars, lack of money).

Name: Enemy Engaged
Description:
While this is not meant to be the be all and end all of space combat systems, and it will most definitely not be the most complicated of them, it is and will be what we envisioned it to be oh those many years ago when we put together a one page set of rules so that we could play with our miniature toys in the kitchen and in the garage on the weekends.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Apples to Apples: Marvel
Description:
The Apples to Apples game ventures into the dazzling domain of the Marvel Universe with a wide array of Marvel Super Heroes and Villains!

As in the classic game, each player takes turns playing the judge. The round starts by the judge playing a Green Apple card. Everyone else plays a Red Apple card from their hand. These cards, with titles like “Black Widow, ” “Web-shooters, ” and “Hulk’s Pants, ” are brought to life with dynamic Marvel comic book images! Amazing combinations are inevitable, but the judge decides the best match-up for each round.

Watch out for the unique “Thanos Snaps” card; it’s a game-changing wild card removing half of players’ Red Apple cards!

Name: トランプ再集計!! (Trump Recount!!)
Description:
The game ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ—å†é›†è¨ˆ!! (Trump Recount!!) consists of a board which shows a map of the United States, with some "battleground" states in white, and other states colored red or blue, to represent their political leanings in the 2020 United States' presidential election.  The game board lists 13 battleground states, and places to play cards for each state along the edge.  (Players must provide their own cards.) The map has a scale showing the progress of J.BIDEN and D.TRUMP towards an electoral college victory.

One player takes the red cards (diamonds and hearts) from a deck of cards, and the other player takes the remaining suits (clubs and spades). First the players gather their heart and spade cards, and, beginning with the red player, alternate placing cards at the 13 battleground states.  Then, the players do the same with the other suits.

Afterwards, the "counting" phase begins, and players have several options, such as to privately count a state and either declare victory or announce that the counting is still in progress; recount a state where your opponent has declared victory; ask for a public recount; or pass.

If any player declares defeat, the opponent's side wins. If neither player declares defeat, the game will never end.

Name: El Juego de Santander
Description:
El Juego de Santander 
The game focuses on the city of Santander, its streets, local businesses and monuments are on the board.

The game play is a mixture of the game of goose and monopoly

To win: acquire businesses and leave the city.

Name: Summon Skate
Description:
In Summon Skate you play a Figure Skater. No, not the kind you’re thinking. Instead you are a summoner who skates out complex magical diagrams to summon Figures - mythical gods and creatures - to fight giant monsters of chaos in high-speed, tactical battles.

The gameplay of Summon Skate is divided between puzzle solving/investigation and tactical combat. Players will check out strange happenings in their city to piece together the true nature of the chaos manifesting there. These investigations generally involve making checks using the simple 3 Attribute, 2D6 roll-under resolution system. Once the mystery is solved, the chaos gathers and takes on a physical form born from human nightmares - a Chaos Figure, the main enemies of this game.

Once combat with the Chaos Figure begins, the players are teleported to a magical stage represented by a 12 x 12 grid. Each turn, players must use their limited movements points to draw out summoning diagrams on the grid. Once a diagram is completed, players can summon the Figure tied to the diagram. Summoned Figures are the primary means of fighting, guarding, healing and supporting in the game. Meanwhile the enemy Chaos Figure will spend its turns trying to either kill the player characters directly or shatter the stage by creating cracks that extend from one side to the other. If all the players run out of HP or the stage is completely shattered, it’s game over and the world falls to chaos. You’ll need cooperation and planning to make it through these battles alive.

—description from the designer

Name: カリフ(Caliph)
Description:
An Islamic roll and move game like Monopoly. Players try to become the Caliph in 10th century Abbasid Baghdad.
Japanese ulamÄ Prof. Dr. Hassan Ko Nakata supervised the game.

In Caliph, cards are arranged in a circle to form a sugoroku board, and the green-framed cards inside are cards that offer advice on life. Players who stop here will use their imagination and Islamic skills to the best of their ability to answer this question, and other players will judge whether the answer is good or bad. A guidebook written by Mr. Nakata for this purpose is included as a reference book. This guidebook can be used as a guideline for judgment, but it does not contain absolute correct answers. In the end, you will have to make a decision based on your own reason and conscience.

The player with the highest total Virtue and Fame at the end of the game is the winner. The game ends if:
-When the caliph was elected. The game ends with the player taking a turn up to the one before the player who became the caliph.
-When the deck runs out. The game ends immediately when the last deck is drawn.

At the end of the game, each player may receive additional points or conceded points depending on the situation.

Name: Doubloons
Description:
Doubloons is a 2-6 player card game of pillage and plunder. Take the helm of a pirate ship in a race for 7 doubloons. Along the way, hire the help from history's most prolific pirates like Samuel Bellamy, Anne Bonny, Ching Shih, and more.

It takes less than 5 minutes to learn. There are two types of cards in the game: action cards and pirate cards. Each player receives 5 action cards to start. On your turn, you draw an action card and then can play up to 3 action cards. Action cards allow you to do things like collect doubloons, draw cards, and steal from other players.

You can choose to spend doubloons in order to recruit pirates onto your crew. These pirates give you effects that can be used once on every turn. Different combinations of action cards and pirates allow you to accelerate your path to victory and decelerate your opponents.

—description from designer

Name: Heroes of Baseball
Description: 'Heroes of Baseball is a 2-player baseball card game that replicates the real-life game decisions of a baseball manager.  The game consists of randomly-generated fictional players, and operates on a d100 (percentile) system.

Name: Special Attractions (fan expansion for Draftosaurus)
Description:
After a period of sustained success, the visitors to your zoo have become complacent and are clamoring for more. It's time to introduce some Special Attractions to your dino park! In this fan-made print-and-play expansion for Draftosaurus, players will draft cards that provide an additional way to score points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Twisted Loyalties
Description:
Throughout history, the Great Clans of Rokugan have held strong to their beliefs. Whether it is the Crab Clan’s adamant defense against the Shadowlands, the Lion Clan’s pride in battle, or the Scorpion Clan’s resolve to do whatever is necessary to serve the Emerald Empire, each of these seven great powers has an ideal that they uphold, a purpose that has become almost synonymous with the clan itself. Steadfast and true, each of the Great Clans walks their respective paths with unflinching resolve.

And yet… temptations still exist.

Twisted Loyalties, the first Dynasty Pack of the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game features 60 brand-new cards (three copies each of nineteen different cards and one copy each of three different cards) to enhance your favorite decks and introduce new mechanics to the game, such as the Dire keyword that opens up new abilities when a character has no fate on them!

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Honor in Flames
Description:
The fissures tearing open within the Emerald Empire have grown into chasms, mighty cracks that divide the seven Great Clans and tear their way of life apart. Every clan now faces its own temptations, and in the face of desperation, the foul practice of mahÅ blood magic grows more widespread. To what depths will your clan sink in the face of the coming storm? And to what heights will they rise as they push forward into the coming darkness?

Like other Dynasty Packs of the Temptations cycle, the 60 cards included within the Honor in Flames expansion for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game provide new dynasty deck and conflict deck options for each of the seven Great Clans, as well as three new provinces. The honor levels of each clan become more important than ever before, and the new dire keyword lets your characters unlock potent new abilities as they near the end of their time in the spotlight. With the expanding Temptations cycle, what dangers will you face—and what choices will you make?

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – A Crimson Offering
Description:
Dire circumstances have gripped the Emerald Empire, pushing every Great Clan to make desperate choices… and perhaps to call upon dark powers better left alone. MahÅ blood magic offers powers for those willing to embrace it—powers that can bring you victory in the struggles for dominance between the clans. But what will you sacrifice to claim this power, and can it possibly be worth the price you pay?

As the Temptations cycle continues with A Crimson Offering, the third Dynasty Pack in the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, every Great Clan is pushed to make more difficult choices with the cards that they receive. The new dire keyword rewards you for walking the line of impermanence, granting your characters powerful new abilities that activate when the character has no fate remaining on it. And like the clans of Rokugan, you’ll face the temptation to include powerful mahÅ cards in your deck, using blood magic to gain any advantage over your opponent.

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Horror in High Gear: Mythos Pack
Description:
Innsmouth is overrun! You and Agent Harper just barely escaped from the coastal fishing hamlet, and now, you’re driving quickly toward Falcon Point Lighthouse—where you hope you can draw more connections between the shattered pieces of your memory. You’ve only been on the road for mere moments, however, before you catch sight of headlights in your rearview mirror. You’re not alone on these desolate, winding roads—and it’s a high-speed chase to the finish!

Strap in for a breakneck race to the finish with the Esoteric Order of Dagon in hot pursuit with Horror in High Gear, the third Mythos Pack in The Innsmouth Conspiracy cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game! Vehicles surge to the forefront in this expansion as you drive your cars along the winding cliffside roads outside of Innsmouth. Alongside this unique scenario, you’ll find a full assortment of player cards for every aspect, unlocking new skills, allies, and more.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Innsmouth Conspiracy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: burncycle: The Specialists
Description:
This expansion provides four new bots with a very particular set of skills to the players' team in Burncycle: a lithe acrobot, a cool getaway expert, a master procurer, and a diversionary tactician.

This expansion adds 4 bot chips, 4 bot awareness tokens and 4 PVC character cards.

Name: burncycle: BioDefend Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds a new Corporation to fight against, and a powerful CEO. BioDefend is a weapons manufacturer, and maybe the most dangerous corporation.

This expansion adds 2 new neoprene rooms, 1 threat card, 8 mission cards, 1 CEO chip, 15 equipment cards and dice, 2 guard captain cards and 2 guard chips, 9 imperative cards, 5 mods.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dothraki Veterans
Description:
The most skilled warriors in the Khalasar.

A Dothraki is effectively born in the saddle. From the earliest age, they learn to ride, becoming the greatest horsemen in the land. After many battles, these horsemen have honed their skills to perfection. Their mastery of swordsmanship, archery, and riding is surpassed by none. In combat, they are a triple threat of strength, speed, and range.

The Dothraki Veterans unit box gives House Targaryen players a multi-faceted new threat to add to their armies. These warriors have trained their abilities to the max, able to perform attacks at range and in close combat. When attacking with their shortbows, they can follow it up with a devastating charge. However, the Dothraki eschew heavy armor, so a good commander will make sure the Veterans are in and out of combat before an enemy has a chance for a retaliatory strike.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series II – Scenario 07: Master the Trials
Description:
Master the Trials is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This scenario has been released separately as part of the September 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package and Print & Play, and then included in Twin Stars: Adventure Series II.

Name: Food Time Battle in Space
Description:
In Food Time Battle in Space in Space, you are a restauranteur in the 1950s trying to take advantage of the recent colonization of the moon in this alternate version of Earth.

This game is a lite engine-building card game for 2-4 players with a healthy amount of randomness, but heaps of strategy, with four different decks, and four different playstyles to choose from.

Your goal is to be the first restaurant to five stars, and you do this by completing critic orders with your ingredients. You have to place ingredients down in the correct order, and to gain critic perks (which help you later in the game) you have to use luxury ingredients as well.

These critic perks are used to increase your handsize, redraw cards, play cards in different orders and discard cards, all in the name of creating the perfect meal for other critics. These abilities are your engine!

—description from the designer

Name: SET: Print & Play Demo
Description:
In the game, certain combinations of three cards are said to make up a set. For each one of the four categories of features — color, number, shape, and shading pattern — the three cards must display that feature as either a) all the same, or b) all different. Put another way: For each feature the three cards must avoid having two cards showing one version of the feature and the remaining card showing a different version.

Winner is who in the end has the most SETs.

In this demo version, only one deck is available.

Published during the COVID-19 Pandemic. 
The publisher posted: "Em solidariedade ao movimento #FIQUEEMCASA e buscando levar mais diversão às famílias brasileiras neste momento de isolamento, disponibilizamos algumas degustações de produtos e jogos no formato Print & Play para serem baixados."

Name: ULUS: Legends of the Nomads
Description:
ULUS is a game aimed at preserving knowledge about Mongolian culture. It is published by the Endangered Alphabets Project, which strives to preserve the many writing systems of the world that are under threat of extinction, including the Mongolian alphabet.

The game is set at the time after Genghis Khan's death, when his successors wondered what form the huge Mongolian empire should have in the future. Should the nomadic culture be preserved? Should Mongols adapt to an urban culture?

Each player adheres to one such idea, asks the support of a deity and a totemic animal and begins to gather the assets that will help their idea to prevail. The game is divided into two phases. The first phase is mostly to gather assets and to attack other players to thwart their plans. Players can choose to play an attack card which the attacked player can defend against. The player of the weaker card will lose strength points which will make it harder to fulfill their tasks in phase two. Alternatively, players can pass or try to force a trade on another player. If they know about a card another player holds, they can ask for it in exchange for any other asset card.

In phase two of the game, players arrive at the great summer festival of Naadam. Here, they compete in three traditional Mongolian sports: archery, horse racing and wrestling. Winners are decided by adding asset modifiers to a player's strength. 
After a final round of trading or attacking, players reveal their collected assets and add their strength to determine the winner.

Rules will be included in English and Mongolian.

Name: Flip the Bottle
Description:
Flip the Bottle is a 2 player game that uses three cards: a rules and score tracking card, a table card, and a bottle card. Players take turns flipping the bottle card and trying to land it bottle-side-up on the table card to score a point. The first player to five points wins the game.


Released in the September 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Noche de Juerga
Description:
In Noche de Juerga ("Binge Night") you have to get 6 cards that are obtained by visiting different places in a city (squares) and do some challenges that are proposed in these.
Once achieved, you must reach the central square.

The first to get it wins

The fun of the game are in challenges proposed during its progress.

—user summary

En el juego hay que conseguir 6 tarjetas que se obtienen visitando distintos lugares de una ciudad (casillas) y hacer algunas pruebas y retos que se proponen en éstas.
Una vez conseguidas se debe llegar a la casilla central.

El primero en conseguirlo, gana

Lo divertido del juego son las pruebas y retos propuestos durante el desarrollo de éste.

—user summary (Spanish)

Name: Eye of the Tiger
Description:
Enjoy the thrill of the fight! Trade your passion for glory!

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Eye of the Tiger by Survivor.

Kicking of the year of One Hit Wonders, we have Eye of the Tiger, which we may just have to shoot a how to play video on the Philadelphia Art Museum steps. Here you will be doing some awsome action selection, which leads into some loud and fun dexterity game (coin tossing).

—description from the publisher


Be the first player to earn 10 Glory.

You get Glory by hitting the Eye of the Tiger (in the postcard) with some pennies (according to your Passion, represented by a die).

In your turn you can do 1 of the following actions as long as the previous player did not take that action:
- increase your Passion
- roll your die to change your Passion randomly
- reduce other players' Passion
- trade Passion for Glory (in a 3-1 rate)
- attempt to gain Glory by hitting the Eye of the Tiger with a number of pennies equal to your Passion (1 or 2 points depending on where the pennies land)


Eye of the Tiger is a postcard game sent to Board Game of the Month Club subscribers in the January 2017 package.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Bits & Bytes
Description:
The goal of Bits & Bytes is for each player to guide their character (program) to their home by issuing instructions (turn right, turn left, move forward, turn around). At the same time they have to avoid walls, bugs and the dreaded Seepeeu (pronounced CPU).

Sounds simple, right? But that’s the point.

Children are playing a card game, but at the same time they are creating computer concepts, like algorithms and the sequencing of instructions, and they are learning the invaluable skill of problem solving. And by doing so they are developing a logical mind-set, which is required for coding/programming. By playing Bits & Bytes, children are developing the logical foundations for programming computers, thus when they start to learn actual coding later in life they already have the required mindset. After all, actual coding (programming) is little more than issuing a few instructions to a computer.

Name: Resources War Game
Description:
In this world very similar to ours, where overpopulation and human greed led to the depletion of practically all the resources on the planet ...

This scarcity of resources sparked internal wars between the nations of each continent without end.

After many years of small wars, combined with countless revolts and coups d'état, panic, fear, despair, led the few remaining nations in this world to start a war like no other! One last war. A war that nobody could escape, that would come to reach the 4 corners of the globe.

That was how the third world war started, also called by many the “War of resources”.

What will be the last nation to stand and gain control of the few resources in the world?

It is up to you to choose one of the remaining nations and dominate what is left of the world.

The objective of the game is to conquer a certain number of territories according to the number of players.

We have two types of troops, some that allow you to pass through the water and others that are only territorial.

A game of escalation where everyone can lose.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 99 Red Balloons by Nena.

Our second month of One Hit Wonders is based on 99 Red Balloons, which was a one hit wonder in the US, but one of many in Nena's native Germany. Other hits include Irgendwie, irgendwo, irgendwann and ? (Fragezeichen).

Designed by Suzanne Zinsli (of Cardboard Edison) this is a neat trick taking game where players are trying to reach the end of the cold war track (9 spaces) before the world war track reaches 9, with 9's being trump!

—description from the publisher


A standard deck of cars is dealt evenly among the players.

A token for each player is put at the beginning of the Cold War track, and another token is put in the World War track.

In each round, every player clockwise takes an action:
- Escalate: play a higher card in the same suit, or any card if you don't have any in suit.
- Stand down: pass until next round.
- Challenge: Play a 9 card (trump, black 9s, and super trump, red 9s).

Play continues until all but one player passes, or if two same-color 9s are played. The player who played the highest on-suit card (or trump or supertrump) takes all the cards played this round.

Set aside all 9s played each round. When all four 9s are played, the hand is over. At the end of the hand, discard any cards in your hand, then add up points for the cards you collected by winning rounds.

If your score was positive, advance your token in the Cold War track. Then, if any player has negative points, take the lowest score and add it to the World War track. If any player reaches the end of the Cold War track, they win. If the World War track reaches its end before any player wins, everyone loses.


99 is a postcard game sent to Board Game of the Month Club subscribers in the February 2017 package.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Into the Lion's Mouth: The Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 -1849
Description:
Following the British victory in the First Anglo-Sikh War (1845 – 1846) the Lahore Durbar, the Sikh Government of the Punjab, effectively came under the control of the British East India Company. In April 1848, two British officers were sent to the prosperous south western city of Multan to take over the running of the province from its governor, Diwan Mulraj Chopra. They were murdered by soldiers of the city’s garrison, apparently acting spontaneously and without the prior knowledge of the startled Mulraj. Nonetheless, after some prevarication, he supported their actions, and thereby found himself the leader of a rebellion against the British.
There were few Sikhs in that part of the Punjab: the garrison was mainly Muslim, and the Mulraj was a Hindu. Because of this, the East India Company regarded the uprising as a purely local affair and sent troops to lay siege to Multan in the expectation that this would quell the rebellion. These included a large body of Sikhs, supposedly loyal to the British, under the command of Sher Singh.

It is now late October 1848. Coming to sympathize with the Mulraj’s grievances against the British and to appreciate how these are shared by the Sikhs, Sher Singh has changed sides.   His men have withdrawn from the siege and are marching north east towards the Punjabi capital, Lahore. Sher Singh’s father, Chattar Singh, has also rebelled against the British and is besieging the fort at Attock which guards the road to Afghanistan. Inspired by the defiance of Sher Singh and Chattar Singh, anti-British disturbances have broken out in towns and cities across the western Punjab.

In response, units of the British East India Company are assembling at Firozpur where they will become the “Army of the Punjab”, under the command of Lord Gough. Gough plans to march against Sher Singh before he is reinforced by Chattar Singh. The monsoon season has ended. Campaigning can commence. So begins the Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 – 1849.

Into the Lion’s Mouth is a two-player beer-and-pretzels game which gives players the opportunity to replicate the British success in re-establishing control over the Punjab, or to re-write history by leading the Sikhs to victory.

—description from the publisher

Name: Borel Dice Edition
Description:
Follow-up game to Borel. This game only contains cards with experiments with dice. The rules are different, and there is more emphasis on speed.

The general framework is like in Borel. The cards describe probability experiments with yes/no answers, for example: "You roll the d10 four times. Will the maximum roll exceed 8?"

You draw a card, and read aloud the question, the players vote yes or no, and you then conduct the experiment. Being good at probability will give you an advantage, but you can also win if the dice roll your way.

In the original game, you bet various amounts of money using chips, and you reveal your bets simultaneously. In this game, the first person to put forward their yes/no card, becomes the "Leader" and gets their preferred outcome, while all the others must bet on the opposite outcome. You get 3 points if you bet correctly. The experiment is then performed a second time, where the players are allowed to bet freely, except for the Leader, and you score 2 points if you bet correctly. First player to 25 points win.

By being the first to commit to a bet and becoming the Leader, you can force all the others to bet the opposite. However, the Leader is not allowed to change their bet in the second round, so betting too quickly can be dangerous, too.

Name: It Really Ties The Room Together
Description:
A game about replacing your defiled rug.

It Really Ties The Room Together is a postcard game to be played with a standard deck of cards, inspired by The Big Lebowski, released in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

There's a little tactical element of the placement of your cards, and there's also a cool card draft where you can just ditch the whole pile of cards and end the round, but at the heavy cost of going last next turn. All in all, a fun little game inspired by a fun little movie.

Name: Sekskantet Domino
Description: Dominoes with tri-coloured hexagonal tiles.

Name: Pass The Pot
Description:
A dynamic push-your-luck dice rolling game.

The gameplay is so simple:

STEP 1 - Roll it.

STEP 2 - Get as high as you can.

STEP 3 - Pass it.

Filled with 55 coins and custom dice, and a pot, players compete to win the pot, and be the first to accumulate 24 coins.

Name: Scissorcards
Description:
A bush sculpting game for 3-5 players.

Inspired on the cult film Edward Scissorhands.


Scissorcards is a realtime dexterity game where you have to form a shrub using playing cards BUT you have to use playing cards instead of your fingers. You setup cards in-between each finger and that's all you get to work with.

The dealer announces start and all players must use their card hands to flip the cards in the center pool and manipulate them to create their bush.

When the dealer decides that a player has built a bush that matches the example bush, the dealer will announce that person as the winner.

The winner scores 1 point. Play continues so that all players have been the dealer. The player with the highest score after that is the winner.


Postcard released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 1 – Twisted Tech
Description:
Discover the bizarre and disturbing technology of the far future, where sinister intentions and limitless possibilities collide...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Face-off against an evil uber-genius obsessed with neural implants

12 New Chapters: Four per act, exploring the stations tech-skewed terrors

10 New Items: Including deadly new weaponry and powerful new cybernetics

7 New Dice: Special new Ammo Dice to accompany the enhanced firepower on offer, plus a 'Tech die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle

New Mechanics: Tactical Drone Selection. During setup, choose which drone your crew will take on the mission. The 'Activate Drone' action now includes a choice of drone ability to trigger, and is no longer limited to merely healing.

Name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 2 – Mutant Syndrome
Description:
Exposed to cosmic radiation and mysterious alien substances, the bodies of many station denizens have begun to gruesomely distort - as have your own...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Encounter an advanced and powerful alpha-mutant.

12 New Chapters : Four per act, plagued by horrific mutant adversaries.

3 New Crew Members: Loyal alien specialists eager to join the mission.

8 New Item Cards: Gruesome crew-mutations, and powerful new cybernetics.

4 New Dice: Three new crew dice, plus a 'Mutation die' used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle.

New Mechanic: Mutations! Crew Members can now fall prey to mutations during the mission, warping their bodies and bringing about both negative and positive effects.

Name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 3 – Quantum Rift
Description:
The very fabric of what you consider real is shattered as you hurtle through time and space - coming face to face with legendary dangers of the distant past...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Battle a creature who wields time itself as a weapon.

12 New Chapters: Four per act, including dangerous historical settings.

3 New Crew Members: Versatile alien friendlies, keen to do take up the fight.

8 New Item Cards: Quest Items, a new type of item card found only in specific time-travel chapters.

4 New Dice: Three crew dice, plus a 'Time die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and item cards, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle.

New Mechanic: Time Travel! With every turn of a chapter card, hold your breath as you risk plummeting through a rift in time, coming face to face with deadly threats from the distant past.

Name: Tomb Looters: Live!
Description:
In a near-future, slightly magicified version of our world, you've been selected as one of the contestants in a new livecast reality show. You’ll compete against other treasure hunters to explore ancient tombs ripe for looting.

But to up the stakes, the producers have rigged a series of demolition charges and given some control of them to the contestants. Time is running out, and no one knows when the roof might cave in.  Will you thwart your opponents and make it out with the most treasure ... or get trapped under a heap of dusty rubble?

With just a pencil, a print-and-play game sheet, and 2d6 for each player, you can play in person or over a video call.

The game plays in phases, and players play out each phase in the dark catacombs simultaneously and secretly, keeping their progress hidden.  They move around the catacombs and roll their dice to unearth treasure, all while trying to avoid (or confront) their opponents.  Looted treasures are kept secret, but after each phase players announce their positions and collapsed spaces on the map.

With your trusty GLM™ helping stow your treasures, you just might be able to snag the most loot.  Oh, and getting out alive would also be nice.

Name: Welcher Dino leuchtet da?
Description: Welcher Dino leuchtet da? is a children's game that in English is named Which Dinosaur Shines Here?

Name: プログラム言語神経衰弱 (Programming Language Memory)
Description:
There has been a communication breakdown.  Players need to find the correct programming language and match them together.
There are ten programming languages and four cards in each language.

The game ends when all the cards have all been taken. Whoever has the most cards wins. If there is more than one person with the most cards, they share in the victory.

This educational game allows players to learn about coding, and to recognize the different languages.  Even though some of the programming functions look very similar, there are subtle differences.  Each card has a barcode pattern at the top to help those learning about programming languages.

'How to play'
Place all the cards face down on the table. When it's your turn, you can turn over two cards from the table, and if they are in the same language, you get them and can take another turn. If they are in a different language, turn them back face down, and it's the turn of the person next to you on the left.

Name: Seek & Find: Safari
Description:
A reimplementation of Muumi viidakkoseikkailu and Coral Reef, Etsi ja löydä Safariseikkailu is a game of fast reactions that has the players flipping two cards and trying to find the animals depicted in the cards from the board as soon as possible.

First player to find both animals scores a point, five points wins the game. Some rounds reward players with camera tokens and it's also possible to win the game by collecting two camera tokens.

Name: Oriental Chess
Description: In this abstract strategy game, each player has 8 identical pieces. They move like rooks, but can't jump over any pieces or land on pieces. Instead, you can capture opponent's pieces either by inclusion of a string or by connecting two strings on a line. You win if you reduce your opponent to at most one piece, unless they can reduce you to at most one piece in their very next turn.

Name: Bollwerk 178
Description:
Bollwerk 178 is a Chess-like complex strategy game for two players.

Each player has 20 strong pieces and 25 supplementary stones at their disposal. The game is played on a board with 178 squares. The game board is in a constant state of change due to the supplementary stones.

The goal of the game is, occupying the opponent’s end field with a piece or a bomb. Whoever captures all his opponent’s pieces or immobilizes their opponent also wins.

On the board there is enormous potential for attacks, sheer unlimited possibilities for various positions, countless options for the next move, as well as an incredibly wide range of defense strategies.

—description from the designer

Name: Dragon Line: Fade and Flow
Description:
Dragon Line is a simultaneous-turns card battle with neat dragon art. The rules are very easy, and games go fast, but there is a lot of complexity to uncover, especially in understanding the ability combos.

Each player builds a small army of dragons with which to face their opponent, chooses in which order the dragons approach the enemy lines, and attempts to be the player with dragons remaining in hand at the end.

This expansion adds two new dragon types to the original Dragon Line deck. If you've bought the second edition of Dragon Line, you already have these cards!

—description from the designer

Name: Dove sei, piccolo Giallo?
Description:
Game inspired from the book "Little Blue and Little Yellow" it is a simple game in which there is a course based on the roll of the dice.
It is a two players game for little children in which there are boxes to balance the game.

—user summary

Name: La Missione Impossibile di Giorgio il Drago
Description:
It is a card game. You have to collect a set of cards to win.
At your turn you can use some cards to block your opponents and obviously play some cards that free yourself if you are previously blocked.

The game is based on the novel of Geoffreoy de Pennart.

Name: Sblocca La Porta Deluxe
Description:
You are locked in a room and you must work together to find the way out, solving puzzles of logic, observation and mathematics. Use the objects you find in the room, observe the smallest details and do not be rushed: if you correctly solve all puzzles, you will leave the room!

The box includes 4 adventures: The Mistery of Orient Express, 
The Treasure Island, The villa of Mr. Gold and the haunted house.

Name: Hot Sauce
Description:
Hot Sauce by Kenneth Thompson. Ken always has a bag of tricks and this one was in the form of about 20 Taco Bell hot sauce packets. He had a neat domino feel tile laying abstract game in which Ben and Jason tightened a wee bit. In the end it's two things: 1) a full game made out of 7 cards or 2) a rule card that you can take with you to your favorite taco restaurant. Both have their perks.

—description from the publisher


A 2-4 player game that is played with sauce packets.

Shuffle the packets and place them into a pile of face-up and face-down packets. TAke the top 2 packets off the pile and place them in the center of the table, face-down next to each other.

Players will take turns drawing a packet from the top of the pile(any one that isn't covered by another packet) and then either 1) placing it in front of them for final scoring, or 2) placing it onto the center of the table so that it connects to a minimum of two other packets. After placing it, the player must flip over a packet that is touching it.

The game ends when the last packet is placed. Players score points for the packets in front of them. Each packet is worth 1 point for each face-up matching packet on the center. If there are no matching packets in the center, packets are -1 each.

Nuclear Packets do not score for players, but are wild in the center. They count as the type of any face-up packet that they are touching.


Released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Cookie Scouts VS Aliens
Description:
It's that time of year again, and the Cookie Scouts are out to earn merit badges and sell cookies.  But this year there's a bit of a twist: the skies are full of saucers and aliens are trying to take over the town!

Even facing the end of the world, the noble Cookie Scouts are still out to earn those merit badges and deliver cookie orders while fighting to save the world.  The whole troop must cooperate to deliver cookie orders, earn merit badges, and help their moms assemble an explosive device to fend off the impending alien invasion.

Yes, you read that right.  Explosive device.

The aliens won't go quietly, however, and the Scouts will have to dodge laser beams, explosions, and freeze rays to complete their challenges and save the world!

Name: Keresis: Quest for the Elements
Description:
Keresis is a strategic game: A mix of exploration, territory control and resource management. Each player takes the lead of an ancestral tribe and faces his opponents to become the master of the four elements.

The chaotic world of Keresis is about to collapse. To save your tribe, you must find a way to reach the lost shrines. As an explorer, you have a special ability and can unlock new powers later during the game. A shaman and some of your fierce warriors will join you in this unique adventure! Dangerous events may occur at any time during your expedition: Will you play it safe by following well known paths or will you put yourself in danger by exploring uncharted territories? The decision is yours!

Each player takes a turn to play and execute some of the following actions: 
Explore
Collect movement points and explore the map / Lay hex tiles and connect them to create paths to follow.

Gather/trade resources
Collect and use the available resources at your disposal: Energy, element stones and powerful action cards.

Control territories / Battle
Use element stones to deploy some of your warriors or expand your domination by invading enemies territories.

Summon your shaman
Protect your territories, rotate them or unleash the mysterious powers contained in the shrines.

Place your amulets
