Each amulet placed on a shrine will bring you one step closer to victory! But it won’t be easy: Each territory is only associated with one shrine. Controlling the right kind of territory is key for placing your amulets!

Will be declared winner the first player to place an amulet on each of the four shrines OR the player with the highest score at the end of twenty-four rounds.

UNIQUE GAME FEATURES:
- 2 difficulty levels: Start as a disciple and become a tribe leader! The adaptable rules set offers a challenging and unique game experience for beginners and experienced players.
- Play in team 2 vs 2 with 4 players (Alliance & Betrayal mode).
- 2 modular board games and 60 unique hex tiles offer near infinite map layouts: You will need to use a different strategy and adapt it each game.

—description from the designer

Name: ¡Aúpa Racing! Real Racing Club Santander
Description:
¡Aúpa Racing!  the first board game about the Racing Santander from Cantabria.

The board represents a map of Spain with 23 soccer fields. The objective of the game is to reach several of these stadiums, through a corridor that will be crossed by throwing a dice. 
It contains 195 questions on the history of the Racing. 
3 categories:

     Matches - Protagonistas (75),
     Games - Partidazos (65) and
     Club (55). 


Each question comes with 3 answers and a photograph is used as a clue to facilitate the correct answer.

Name: Catan: Das Duell – Finstere & Goldene Zeiten
Description: Catan: Das Duell – Finstere & Goldene Zeiten ("Dark & Golden Times") contains six theme sets to expand Rivals for Catan, with you being able to fend off barbarian raids, discover new islands, and more.

Name: Poco Pinata
Description:
Poco Pinata is a micro-game that features only a handful of cards that has players take on one of two roles. One player closes their eyes and spins like it was there turn with the bat at a kids’ birthday party. Then they try to smack their token (they suggest coins) on one of the pinata cards on the table. Other players get a chance to move a card while the active player’s eyes are closed to try and stop them from hitting it and getting the candy. It’s a fun little game that is light for all audiences and it’s always fun to see people spinning around like fools and shouting.


Ryan Cowler's Poco Pinata (originally named A Lotta Piñata) is a dizzy dexterity game where you slap coins onto piñatas, trying to burst them for the candy inside.


Released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Scrumdiddlyumptious
Description:
A yummy deduction game that will fill your belly.

In May, we went with a candy theme. The film was one of the cultiest of the cult films, yet also a family film based on a non-cult book... Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

Matthew O' Malley (Diner, Between Two Cities, Knot Dice) and Peter O' Malley designed Scrumdiddlyumptious, a deduction game that uses candy as its pieces! It's pure confection. I mean pure perfection. Or pure imagination? Anyway, it's so good, especially when you can eat the candy. :)

The art was completed by my daughter Beatrix Tagmire and son Leon Tagmire. It felt too fitting to not have kids do the artwork.

—description from the publisher


You actually play with real candy. Players grab handfuls of candy with different types (different colors, different brands, etc), and hide their stash from the other players. They then take turns using powers described on the card trying to get another player to eat pieces from their stash. The last person with candy still in their stash wins. But is losing really so terrible when it means you get to eat all that candy?


Postcard released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
Families: Books: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

Name: Rock Paper Kittens
Description:
Ben Begeal's Rock Paper Kittens is an RPS game that pauses for some social shenanigans.

All 3 cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table. The active player will look at 2 cards, choose to keep one as their role and placing the other back on the table face down. With two cards remaining, the active player will offer one to the other player. That player will choose to take the card offered or the other face down card as their weapons. Roles are resolved by RPS rules.

—description from the publisher


Released in the April 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Fantascatti Occhio al Tranello
Description:
Tommy is a young detective who specialized himself in very peculiar cases.
Despite his age, he is not afraid to explore old abandoned castles, armed only with a camera, looking for scary ghosts. However, the ghost Tommy is looking for is very shy. Therefore, it tries to deceive the young detective with tricks.

Players reveal a trick card, which depicts a different trick among 4 kinds (visual, linguistic, logical, numerical). To solve it, players have to compare the revealed card with the trick deck’s top card. Only the fastest player will be able to catch the right object.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mediterralien
Description:
A merchant in the Mediterranean is just trying to buy low and sell high, but an alien from another world is making that difficult by destroying everything in sight.

In this asymmetrical 2 player game, one player takes the role of a merchant in a worker placement / action point game, while the other player takes the role of alien with swingy die rolls and special powers.


An asymmetric clash of board game styles. One player is a merchant shipping goods through the Mediterranean Sea (worker placement, action selection). The other player is an alien bent on destruction (die rolls / special powers).


Released in the January 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: The Time Warp
Description:
A drafting game about sharing things up.

Cult Film Postcard Game: The Time Warp, inspired by the cult classic The Rocky Horror Picture Show. It was designed by Dead of Winter’s Jonathan Gilmour and Curtis E. Clark.


Postcard released in the July 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Make the best 5 card poker hand out of your six cards after 3 rounds.

SETUP
Shuffle the deck and deal 3 cards to each player. Place the remaining deck in the center within reach of all players.

GAMEPLAY
Perform the following steps in order (each step consist in a specific way of drafting, drawing or playing cards):

     It's just a jump to the left
     Then a step to the riiiiiiight
     With your hands to your hips
     You bring your knees in tiiiiight
     But it's the pelvic trust
     That really drives you insaaaane
     Let's do the Time Warp again


GAME END
After three rounds, players will reveal their hands, comparing to see who has made the best 5 card poker hand.
They have Time Warped the best.

Name: Trump Wall
Description:
Trump Wall is a game for 2 players or two teams of 2 players where one person/team is trying to connect the Pacific Ocean to the Caribbean Sea and the other person/team is trying to connect Mexico to the United States.

The game board shows a hex grid, and each hex is labeled with either a traditional card suit (e.g. hearts or clubs) or a traditional card rank (e.g. Ace, 3, 4, Jack).  The rules state that the game does not come with the necessary writing implements or playing cards, and that you should charge Mexico for the cost of these.

On a turn, a player chooses to either play a card from their hand and mark an appropriate hex for their side or pass.  If a player passes, they discard their hand and draw replacement cards for each and one additional card.  If a player did play a card and mark a hex, they also draw one card.

The game ends when one player/team connects their two-sides through hexes marked for their side.

Name: Mocarstwa: Wydanie II Rozszerzone
Description:
Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.

This second extended edition adds:

     new game mechanics based on Combat Cards eliminate the randomness of the game and significantly accelerate its course
     new scenarios, also in solo mode
     Power Cards that give each ruler individual options
     additional types of troops

Name: Farmerstein
Description:
The life of a farmer is hard: hands covered with calluses, waking up at dawn, smelling manure constantly...in short, a nightmare. This is why some tired farmers have decided to make the most sensible choice: Follow the legacy of Doctor Farmerstein, and devote themselves to conquering the world! With a large number of potions and mutagenic agents, they are now capable of giving life to plants to build a fearsome and large army!

In the card game Farmerstein, you play the role of mad scientists who launch their GMOs to conquer the world, with your soldiers being asparagus, mushrooms, cucumbers, and tomatoes mutated into monstrous bloodthirsty creatures. Your goal is to conquer three continents — America, Europe, and Asia — and to do this you need to combine your vegetables and chemicals in the order required by the target cards. The game involves a lot of twisted interactions between players, but with one huge problem in common: the invasion of zombie zucchini, creatures so out of control that nobody can stop them!

Name: Factory Floor
Description:
Factory Floor is a light weight, polyomino (tetris-tiles) placement board game for 1-4 players.

As a fresh faced factory builder your tasked with building the most productive facility using the limited space provided in the most effective way possible. Using production facilities and quality control to increase the overall output of the factory, further increases to your output is made by the hiring and allocation of workers

Each player starts a with a floor space of 12x8 which can be make more difficult with the inclusion of column pieces. Each then takes turns selecting tiles or hiring workers to make the very most of their floor space and labor pool

After 5 production phases, and just one work week, the player who has managed to create the greatest output is named the manufacturing mogul supreme.

—description from the designer

Name: Hibi Hibi Rescue
Description:
As a Cadet of the Galactic Rescue Patrol you must bring back home, safe and healthy, this pile of Hibis that we have rescued from the claws of Zeta and his dangerous Alphabots.

Hibis are endearing creatures that like to play and organize themselves in mathematical herds of colors. Their planet, Trezion, is far away, just far enough to have time to organize them well for a safe landing.

Look out for those rare Hibis that we have not managed to identify! Be careful with their mood! Order them wisely with the help of your Technoglove and become their adventure friend. Show what you are capable of!

Players will use cards from their hand to place the Hibis and make addition and subtraction with them.

—description from the designer
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: The Miri
Description:
STRANGE STUFF IS HAPPENING ALL AROUND US, LET THE CARDS BE OUR GUIDE! 
The Miri is a cooperative storytelling game where players contribute image cards to a storyteller to interpret. Players roleplay through those interpretations, using their own cards and rolling a 12-sided die to influence what happens in the story.

Players begin the game choosing one of the 18 Aspect Cards, becoming that character in story. Do you want to use muscle like The Warrior, or perhaps your intellect, like The Scientist. Are you more in tune with something spiritual, like The Shaman? There are many ways to play it!

Card by card, the story unfolds...

Each round, the storyteller lays contributed cards, as well as a few unknown cards, in a face-down spread. The reading of the images is performed similar to how a fortune teller would read Tarot, with images deriving meaning, and the orientation of the cards mattering. "Ordered" cards (correctly viewed) add positive events to the story, and perilous events happen when cards are "Mirrored" (upside-down).

During the reading of a spread, players are given the opportunity to say what they would like their character to do, and roll the die to see if their actions were successful. If players are successful, they may begin to turn cards in the spread to become ordered. A spread containing an Ordered Mind (blue), Body (red), and Spirit (green) card is considered a success for The Miri, and flips the next of five Suspense tiles in favor of The Miri.

However… Being unsuccessful in Ordering the cards allows the dark forces known as Ichor to get its clutches on the story! If all three Clutches of Ichor tokens are placed on the cards in the spread, you flip the next of five Suspense tiles back over in favor of Ichor.

If all five Suspense tiles show "The Miri", you WIN and conclude the story with a victory for the players! ...Unless the story was lost to the Clutches of Ichor!

—description from the designer
